description: A 16' Harmonica. Audsley gives a scale for square wooden pipes of 4.44" at CCC, 2.73" at CC, 1.67" at C, and 1.25" at G, ratio 1:2.66, on 2.5" to 3" of wind. Wedgwood says that it �corresponds to a small-scaled Major Bass or wood Violon. Examples Harmonikabass 16', Pedal; New Synagogue, Berlin Germany; Walcker 1910 (destroyed). Harmonikabass 16', Pedal; Hauptorgel, Passau Cathedral, Bavaria, Germany; Steinmeyer 1924-26. Harmonikabass 16', Pedal; St. Martin, Dornbirn, Austria; Behmann, 1927 (restored 1986). Harmonicabass 16', Pedal; Catholic Church, Berne, Switzerland. Bibliography Audsley[1]: Harmonicabass. Audsley[2]: I.XIII Harmonicabass; II.XXXIV Harmonica. Locher[1]: Harmonica Bass. Wedgwood[1]: Harmonika. FOOTER Original website compiled by Edward L. Stauff. For educational use only. Harmonicabass.html - Last updated 23 December 2000. Home Full Index
